Package org.connect4

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.connect4.GameBoard
  • public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the game board containing the game pieces.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  GameBoard.InvalidMoveException
      Custom Exception for Illegal moves selected by players.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GameBoard​(int width, int height, int piecesForWin)
      Creates a new game board with the specified dimensions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean isFull()
      Check whether the whole board has been filled without achieving victory.
      boolean isNotOver()
      Determines whether one player has achieved victory or if the game is over in a draw.
      void makeMove​(boolean playerOne, int move)
      Execute the move for the selected player in the selected column, that means flipping the bottommost unassigned game tile in that column.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Generate a String representation of the game board consisting of '_' for empty tiles.
      boolean winnerPlayerOne()
      Check which player is victorious

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard​(int width,
                 int height,
                 int piecesForWin)
        Creates a new game board with the specified dimensions.
        Parameters:
        width - the number of columns.
        height - the number of rows.
        piecesForWin - The number of pieces in a line required for winning.

    • Method Detail

      • isNotOver

        public boolean isNotOver()
        Determines whether one player has achieved victory or if the game is over in a draw.
        Returns:
        true if the game is still ongoing, otherwise false.

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove​(boolean playerOne,
                     int move)
              throws GameBoard.InvalidMoveException
        Execute the move for the selected player in the selected column, that means flipping the bottommost unassigned game tile in that column.
        Parameters:
        playerOne - true if it is player one making the move, false for player two.
        move - The ID of the column in which to make a move.
        Throws:
        GameBoard.InvalidMoveException - The move could not be made because the column does not exist or is already full.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Check whether the whole board has been filled without achieving victory. Thus the game ends in a draw.
        Returns:
        true if the game board has no more unassigned tiles.

      • winnerPlayerOne

        public boolean winnerPlayerOne()
                        throws InvalidStateException
        Check which player is victorious
        Returns:
        True if player one has won, false for player two.
        Throws:
        InvalidStateException - The game ended in tie or is not over yet.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Generate a String representation of the game board consisting of '_' for empty tiles. 'x' for player one and 'o' for player two.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Representation of the game board.
